txt.en: 'My brothers and I thirst for revenge against Orcs and Uruks who slew our kin. One seeks mindless vengeance, while the other seeks restitution - neither understands our foes truly. Orcs are cowards at heart, fighting only when driven by stern and heartless leaders. If we are to know peace again, then these leaders must be felled before they drive their hordes upon us once again.\n\nIt is the ones who led the raid who must be slain. The Ongburz chieftain Nûlthauk can be found deep within their cave north of here. Destroy him and the driving power behind the Orcs will be shattered for a time.'
'So, you have slain Nûlthauk? This was a deed well done! But there is more yet for you to do to complete our vengeance.'
'You must slay Nûlthauk, the Orc who led his minions when they slew our kin!'
Eilig and his brothers Machar and Torquil are seeking vengeance against Orc-raiders who slew their kin.
The Orc-cave is north of Aughaire, just east of Dûn Covád.\n\nEilig has asked you to slay the Ongburz Chieftain, Nûlthauk who led the Orcs who slew his kindred.
Eilig is back at Aughaire.\n\nNûlthauk is dead, so you should return to Eilig to tell him the tale of your deeds.
